qas.question: What is the name of the program that IBM uses to search for new start-up companies to solve world problems?
How many SmartCamp events does IBM hold worldwide?
Who has IBM partnered with to allow retail shoppers to easily donate money?
Charities of which nation benefit from the IBM partnership with Pennies?
What company is known for the electronic charity box?
What global program is run by Pennies so that they can find companies to partner with?
What kind of companies does Pennies search for to partner with?
What did Pennies go into business to solve in the UK?
How many companies partner with Pennies in their retail stores in the UK?
In what year did Pennies begin as a start-up?

context: IBM also holds the <a0_0><b5_0>SmartCamp<b5_0/><a0_0/> program globally. The program searches for <b6_0>fresh start-up companies<b6_0/> that IBM can partner with to solve <b7_0>world problems<b7_0/>. IBM holds <a1_0><b8_0>17<b8_0/><a1_0/> SmartCamp events around the world. Since July <b9_0>2011<b9_0/>, IBM has partnered with <a2_0><a4_0>Pennies<a4_0/><a2_0/>, the electronic charity box, and produced a software solution for IBM retail customers that provides an easy way to donate money when paying in-store by credit or debit card. Customers donate just a few pence (1p-99p) a time and every donation goes to <a3_0>UK<a3_0/> charities.
